result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Arson of Property Other Than Building

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexandra M Steinmetz

records.addlTxt: Motion of the Defense to dismiss on 10/25/2022, taken under advisement.

Defendant Alexandra M Steinmetz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke appeared by video for Alexandra M Steinmetz.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness not present; State requested adjournment. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION and NO CONTACT with H.M.F., S.M.F., and Children's Hospital.

Defendant Alexandra M Steinmetz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke appeared by video for Alexandra M Steinmetz.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Doctor's Report Return.  It is the opinion of the examining psychologist, Daniel Stabin, that Ms. Steinmetz does not lack substantial mental capacity to understand the proceedings.  Parties do not contest the findings.  Court adopts the Doctor's findings.  Court set cash bail.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION and NO CONTACT with H.M.F., S.M.F., and Children's Hospital. 

Court scheduled a preliminary hearing.  Parties stipulate to waiving time limits.  State will file an Order to Produce.  Case adjourned to Branch PE, Rm 146 CJF.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court rescheduled Doctor's Report Return to October 4, 2022 at 1:30 PM in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.  Parties notified of next court date.
Received and Filed: Doctor's Report Dated 09-23-2022
signed, Order of Commitment for Treatment

Defendant Alexandra M Steinmetz in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties review and do not contest report.  Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame. Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment signed and filed. Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report, Branch 2.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alexandra M Steinmetz in court, defendant in custody with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke, appear by video. Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alexandra M Steinmetz not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Alexandra M Steinmetz in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Alexandra M Steinmetz in custody.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alexandra M Steinmetz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with HMF

Defendant Alexandra M Steinmetz not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 3/11/2022. Defendant is in custody at Waukesah County Jail. Needs to be produced for court.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/11/22 @ 2:30p
